intro: Onopyxus nutans, commonly known as the hanging bellflower, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its pendulous, bell-shaped flowers that hang from the stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. The flowers, which range in color from white to pale blue, bloom in late spring to early summer.
